newsitem.title: USA: Fidelity Financial plans stock buyback.
newsitem.headline: Fidelity Financial plans stock buyback.

text.p: Fidelity Financial of Ohio Inc said Friday that its board has authorized the repurchase of up to 279,698 shares, or five percent, of its common stock.
The program will start upon approval from the U.S. Office of Thrift Supervision, the company said. Fidelity Financial has more than five-and-a-half million shares outstanding.
The program will expire March 4, 1998, it said.
The company said the repurchased shares will be held as treasury stock and will be available for such corporate purposes as the award of stock options.
Fidelity said it has $531.1 million in assets.
